body:
Hmmm. This should have been fixed recently. And I have seen them popping up. 

I’ll have a closer look at what’s going on.
Yeah, I didn't mention https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/42815 before you mentioned recent fixes. Ok, I only used what is already deployed.
Yeah https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/42835 should have fixed it and I really saw these config properties pop up so there's something odd.
And they disappeared the next day: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkusio.github.io/commit/7ed3ff6a02f644c429a7f8db39bc71828d04de37
Ah I see in the 3.14.2, they are around but don't have javadoc. So there might be an issue with how the javadoc is resolved, it's a different process.

OK, so the first fix actually made them appear in the model but there's a problem with the Javadoc collection (which is done separately) and the Javadoc for the config group is not around thus the problem.

Need to go do some cooking for now but will have a look after, it will be a simple fix hopefully.

issue.title: Config Doc - Configure OIDC Common annotation processor for legacy root

body:
https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/43115 will take care of it.

So the first issue was that the properties weren't present in the model, this is what the previous patch fixed (and I actually checked they were in the model, thus why I was surprised).
The model is built where the `@ConfigRoot` is and can resolve ``@ConfigGroup``s that are in a dependency.

But the Javadoc cannot be accessed from another module so it's actually collected locally (and then later aggregated).

There was another issue: the OIDC Common artifact wasn't configured for legacy config roots (I looked for `@ConfigRoot` everywhere but this artifact is specific as you only have a `@ConfigGroup` and no `@ConfigRoot`).

So it was looking for methods and not fields and thus didn't collect the Javadoc.
